question:
In light of the recent cabinet approval for creation of the post of Chief of Defence Staff, consider the following statements:
  1. The CDS will be the principal and only military adviser to the Defence Minister, replacing the 3 chiefs.
  2. The CDS will head the department of military affairs.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Chief of Defence Staff will be the principal military advisor to the union defence minister. However, he/ she will not be the only such advisor. The chiefs of the 3 armed forces will continue to advise the minister on matters concerning their own branch. Statement 2 is correct: The CDS will head the department of military affairs. The CDS will be the permanent chairperson of the chief of staff committee and will administer the tri-service agencies in relation to space and cyber fronts. The CDS will head the integrated headquarters of the 3 defence forces.
